definition: mirror writing/upside down writing
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to write
pictogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character derived from a picture/sometimes called hieroglyph
prefix
form of a Chinese character/variant of 字型[zi4 xing2]
phonetic letters
probably/most likely
old character/archaic form of a Chinese character
original form of a Chinese character
see 篆書|篆书[zhuan4 shu1]
a Chinese character formed by combining existing elements - i.e. a combined ideogram 會意|会意 or radical plus phonetic 形聲|形声
ideogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character indicating an idea, such as up and down/also known as self-explanatory character
component of a Chinese character (as the radical or the phonetic part)
name of "water" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 85)/see also 氵[shui3]
regular script (Chinese calligraphic style)
strokes of a Chinese character
style of writing (literary style)/way of writing a character/spelling
(colloquial) grapheme 攵 (variant form of Kangxi radical 66, 攴)
